title: Cannot install py-ipython -- no reasonable error message -- how to debug?
body:
When trying to install a package (`py-yt`) that depends on `py-ipython`, I encounter an error:
```
==> Installing py-ipython
==> Using cached archive: /Users/eschnett/src/spack/var/spack/cache/py-ipython/py-ipython-6.0.0.tar.gz
==> Staging archive: /Users/eschnett/src/spack/var/spack/stage/py-ipython-6.0.0-6fpapngzec2htcor6wusiiszsedzdfht/ipython-6.0.0.tar.gz
==> Created stage in /Users/eschnett/src/spack/var/spack/stage/py-ipython-6.0.0-6fpapngzec2htcor6wusiiszsedzdfht
==> Ran patch() for py-ipython
==> Building py-ipython [PythonPackage]
==> Executing phase : 'build'
==> '/Users/eschnett/src/spack/opt/spack/darwin-sierra-x86_64/clang-8.1.0-apple/python-2.7.13-lbt26chwl7kqnobyhddt2kt4cutpwxrw/bin/python2.7' 'setup.py' '--no-user-cfg' 'build'

==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 1:
    '/Users/eschnett/src/spack/opt/spack/darwin-sierra-x86_64/clang-8.1.0-apple/python-2.7.13-lbt26chwl7kqnobyhddt2kt4cutpwxrw/bin/python2.7' 'setup.py' '--no-user-cfg' 'build'
/Users/eschnett/src/spack/lib/spack/spack/build_systems/python.py:129, in python:
     128      def python(self, *args, **kwargs):
  >> 129          inspect.getmodule(self).python(*args, **kwargs)

See build log for details:
  /private/var/folders/gl/zvl8d6415vsbkd50nnll95k40000gs/T/eschnett/spack-stage/spack-stage-o2dAFi/ipython-6.0.0/spack-build.out
```

`spack-build.out` contains only this:
```
==> '/Users/eschnett/src/spack/opt/spack/darwin-sierra-x86_64/clang-8.1.0-apple/python-2.7.13-lbt26chwl7kqnobyhddt2kt4cutpwxrw/bin/python2.7' 'setup.py' '--no-user-cfg' 'build'

```

No further output exists to debug this. It seems that the call to `setup.py` fails, but I can't see any log output or error message. How do I debug this?
